facts.text: The Supporters' Shield is awarded to the MLS team with the best regular season record.
The Supporters' Shield has been awarded since 1999, with winners from 1996 to 1998 awarded retroactively.
Since 2006, the Supporters' Shield winner has earned a berth in the CONCACAF Champions Cup.
D.C. United and LA Galaxy have each won the Supporters' Shield four times, the most of any team.
Inter Miami CF won the Supporters' Shield for the first time in 2024.
Inter Miami CF holds the record for the most points in a regular season with 74 in 2024.
The idea for the Supporters' Shield was proposed by Nick Lawrus in 1997.
The Supporters' Shield was created with nearly $3,000 in donations, including contributions from ESPN commentator Phil Schoen and MLS commissioner Doug Logan.
The first Supporters' Shield was made by Paula Richardson from sterling silver sheet metal for $2,200.
D.C. United was the first MLS club to win the Supporters' Shield, with their victory occurring in the 1999 season.
On eight occasions, the winner of the Supporters' Shield also won the MLS Cup in the same year.
In 2011, the league announced that the Shield winner's opponent in the MLS Cup quarterfinals would be the lowest-seeded team remaining.
The Supporters' Shield Foundation was created in 2012 with a mission to fund the creation of a new shield and manage the trophy.
The new Supporters' Shield, created in early 2013, weighs 35 pounds and is made of sterling silver and stainless steel.
The New York Red Bulls were the first team to be awarded the newly designed Supporters' Shield in 2013.
The Supporters' Shield was not initially going to be awarded in the 2020 season due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but the decision was reversed after backlash from the MLS community.
The Philadelphia Union won the Supporters' Shield in 2020 but used a temporary replacement shield due to a delay in shipping the actual shield.
LA Galaxy and D.C. United have won the most Supporters' Shields, with four wins each.
Seven teams have won both the Supporters' Shield and the MLS Cup in the same season, with LA Galaxy and D.C. United achieving this double twice.
Toronto FC is the only Canadian team to have won the Canadian version of a domestic treble, lifting the Supporters' Shield, MLS Cup, and Canadian Championship in the 2017 season.
Before 2006, Supporters' Shield winners were not guaranteed a berth into CONCACAF competitions.
Since what year did the MLS Supporters' Shield winner replace the MLS Cup runner-up as the second American representative for the CONCACAF Champions' Cup?
In what year did the CONCACAF Champions League format change, allowing the MLS Supporters' Shield winner and MLS Cup winner to earn direct byes into the group stage?
Which two MLS Supporters' Shield winners have reached the final of a CONCACAF competition?
Toronto FC and Los Angeles FC
For what reason did Toronto FC participate in the 2018 CONCACAF Champions League?
Winning the Canadian Championship
Which two teams hold the record for the earliest exit in a CONCACAF competition as the Shield winners, being eliminated from the group stage?
D.C. United (2008-09) and New York Red Bulls (2014-15)
In what year were Canadian MLS teams first able to earn a berth through the Supporters' Shield?
How were MLS game outcomes scored from 1996 to 1999 in terms of points?
3 points for a win in 90 minutes, 1 point for a shootout win, 0 points for a loss in 90 minutes or shootout
Since what year are 3 points awarded for a win, 1 point for a tie, and 0 points for a loss in MLS?
How were tied games decided in MLS from 1996 until 1999?
By a golden goal, culminating with a shootout
Inter Miami CF set the MLS single-season points record in 2024.
Lionel Messi scored a hat trick for Inter Miami CF on October 20, 2024.
The Supporters' Shield was not awarded in 2020 initially but the decision was reversed on October 23, 2020.
Philadelphia Union celebrated with a fake Supporters' Shield in 2020 after the initial decision to not award it.
The original MLS Supporters' Shield was designed by two Kansas University students.
The Supporters' Shield started from an internet message board to become a valued prize in MLS.
D.C. United won the Supporters' Shield in both 1997 and 1999.
LA Galaxy won the Supporters' Shield in 1998, 2002, 2010, and 2011.
New York Red Bulls won the Supporters' Shield in 2013, 2015, and 2018.
Los Angeles FC won the Supporters' Shield in 2019 and 2022.
Tampa Bay Mutiny and Miami Fusion, teams that no longer exist in MLS, won the Supporters' Shield in 1996 and 2001, respectively.
The Tampa Bay Mutiny won the Supporters' Shield in the inaugural MLS season of 1996.
D.C. United won the MLS Cup in 1997 under the coaching of Bruce Arena.
The Los Angeles Galaxy were the Supporters' Shield winners in 1998.
D.C. United won their second MLS Cup in 1999 with Thomas Rongen as their coach.
The Kansas City Wizards won the MLS Cup in 2000, coached by Bob Gansler.
The Miami Fusion won the Supporters' Shield in 2001 but lost in the Semifinals.
The Los Angeles Galaxy won their second MLS Cup in 2002 with Sigi Schmid as the coach.
The Chicago Fire won the Supporters' Shield in 2003 but lost the MLS Cup final.
The Columbus Crew won the Supporters' Shield in 2004, with Greg Andrulis as their coach.
In 2008, Columbus Crew won the MLS Cup under the management of Sigi Schmid.
Los Angeles Galaxy won the MLS Cup 4 times in the years 1998, 2002, 2010, and 2011.
D.C. United has won the MLS Cup 4 times, with their victories coming in the years 1997, 1999, 2006, and 2007.
Toronto FC won the MLS Cup in 2017.
Philadelphia Union lost in the first round of the MLS playoffs in 2020.
FC Cincinnati reached the Conference Finals in 2023 but lost to Columbus Crew.
Inter Miami CF, managed by Gerardo Martino, lost in the first round of the playoffs in 2024.
Seattle Sounders FC won the MLS Cup in 2014.
New England Revolution won the MLS Cup in 2021.
Los Angeles FC won the MLS Cup in 2022 under the management of Steve Cherundolo.
Toronto FC reached the finals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2018.
Los Angeles FC reached the finals of the CONCACAF Champions League in 2020.
In which year did FC Cincinnati reach the Round of 16 in a competition? Answer: 2024.
In 2025, which team reached the Semi-Finals? Answer: Inter Miami CF.
